training_data.label: COVID_Pneumonia
training_data.description: COVID pneumonia is a lung infection caused by SARS CoV-2, the virus that causes COVID-19. It causes fluid and inflammation in your lungs.
symptoms: blueish lips skin or nails cyanosis

training_data.label: AA_Amyloidosis
training_data.description: AA amyloidosis, or secondary amyloidosis, is one type of the rare disorder amyloidosis. This disorder happens when proteins in your body mutate, changing form and gathering on your organs and tissues.

training_data.label: Alpers_Disease
training_data.description: Alpers disease is a rare genetic disorder that leads to dementia, liver failure and seizures. Symptoms usually start between ages 2 and 4 or ages 17 and 24.
symptoms: loss of controll over arms and legs

training_data.label: Alergies
training_data.description: Allergies are your body’s reaction to normally harmless substances.
symptoms: worsening of asthma or eczema symptoms
itchy all over your body or a specfic part of your body

training_data.label: Abdominal_Aortic_Aneurysm
training_data.description: An abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) is a bulge in the part of your aorta that runs through your belly.
symptoms: severe pain near belly button or lower legs

training_data.label: Aphasia
training_data.description: Aphasia is a brain disorder where a person has trouble speaking or understanding other people speaking.

training_data.label: Abdominal_Migraine
training_data.description: Abdominal migraine is a condition that causes episodes of moderate to severe abdominal (belly) pain lasting one to 72 hours.

training_data.label: Aphonia_Loss_of_Voice
training_data.description: Inability to speak clearly low tone.
symptoms: low tone unable to be heard

training_data.label: Alzheimer's_Disease
training_data.description: Alzheimer’s disease causes a decline in memory, thinking, learning and organizing skills over time.
symptoms: unable to do certain tasks effectively
zhoning out when asked a question

training_data.label: Biliary_Stricture
training_data.description: Biliary strictures, also called bile duct strictures, occur when the ducts that carry bile from your liver to your small intestine become narrow or blocked.
symptoms: changes in stool poop color gray pale colors

training_data.label: Bacteremia
training_data.description: Bacteremia is when you have bacteria in your blood

training_data.label: Broken_Ankle
training_data.description: Broken ankles, or ankle fractures, are one of the most common causes of ankle pain.

training_data.label: Broken_Femur
training_data.description: A broken femur is a serious injury that requires immediate medical care. Broken femurs are treated with surgery and physical therapy.
symptoms: cannot put weight on injured leg
peices of femur break through skin and cause bleeding
parts of the thigh is swollen
injured leg is shorter then uninjured leg

training_data.label: Barth_Syndrome
training_data.description: Barth syndrome is a rare genetic condition that causes severe health issues. It typically affects boys. The condition occurs when a gene mutation affects the body’s ability to support cells’ energy-producing capabilities.
symptoms: Unsually high levels of an organic acid in the urine
cannot put weight on injured leg
enlargement of the heart’s lower chambers
injured leg is shorter then uninjured leg
Weakness in the muscles that help you move skeletal myopathy

training_data.label: Bloated_Stomache
training_data.description: A bloated stomach feels tight, full and often painful. You might feel bloated even if you don’t have a distended abdomen.
symptoms: full stomach inable to partake in tasks properly
feeling like you are going to vomit

training_data.label: Sprained_Ankle
training_data.description: A sprained ankle is a common injury that occurs when the ankle ligaments are torn or stretched too far, often after a fall, or if you roll or twist your ankle.
symptoms: miled pain  when applying pressure to affected area of the ankle
